result.execSummary:
The defendant Dominic Champagne Glass was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Dominic Champagne Glass was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dominic Champagne Glass is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Dominic Champagne Glass was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable costs, fees and surcharges.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a conditon of Extended Supervision.  Any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment.

Defendant is eligible for Challenge incarceration Program after serving two (2) years.  After serving 18 months, defendant eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program......***OCTOBER 30, 2014/ORDER AMENDING JOC: Judge William Pocan: the JOC shall be amended to reflect 113 days of sentence credit***

records.addlTxt: See case no. 14CF000122 for Request for payment of witness fees prepared by the DA's Victim/Witness Services dated 4/2/14 for Chee V, Amanda Y, Rochelle C., Mariah S., Zykeria S. for 1 appearance each on 3/31/14.

Defendant Dominic Champagne Glass in court with attorney Joseph E Schubert.  Defendant Dominic Champagne Glass in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Presentence report reviewed.  Statements made as to sentencing.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS, with credit for 123 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 years; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 years.  The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program after serving 2 years.   After serving 18 months, defendant eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
Terms of extended supervision:
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with the Department
-Possess no weapons
-AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment
-Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens
-No contact with Amanda Y, Chee V.
-Seek and maintain full time employment
Restitution set at zero.
The court ordered defendant provide DNA sample--pay surcharge through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant
The Court ordered all applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant   
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting

Defendant Dominic Champagne Glass in court with attorney Joseph E. Schubert.  Defendant Dominic Champagne Glass in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sheriff Deputies sworn.  Jury continues deliberations at 8:36am.  Question #2 8:53am.  Question #3 9:15am.   At the hour of 10:08am the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of Guilty on count 1 and Not Guilty on count 2 which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Defendant removed from the court room.  
Case recalled all parties present.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction on Count 1.  Court orders presentence investigation and defendant REMANDED pending sentencing on MAY 7, 2014, 8:30am.  kmw
**********
Court orders jury list sealed

Defendant Dominic Champagne Glass in court with attorney Joseph E. Schubert.  Defendant Dominic Champagne Glass in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury in box 8:51am.  Witness sworn and testified:  Detective Chaperon, Officer O Procopio.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box.  Defense motion for dismissal denied by the court.  Jury in the box.  Sworn for defense: Officer M Gretendhardt, Officer M. Fasulo.  Defense rests.  Jury out of box 10:08am.  Case recalled.  Jury in box 1:43pm.  Same appearances.  Defense rests.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 2:48pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies who were duly sworn for that purpose. Jury out of box.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied.  
Question #1 at 3:20pm.
On the record.  All parties present.  Jury in box 3:44pm to address question.  Jury out of box.
4:51pm.  Jury in box and trial adjourned to APRIL 2, 2014, 8:30am.  kmw

Exhibits 1,2,3,6,7,8 offered and received.

State files an AMENDED INFORMATION as to 
Count 1:  the court amended the charge to Possession of a firearm by a Felon, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 941.29(2)(a) , a class G FELONY. 
Count 2:  the court amended the charge to Endangering Safety by Use of a Dangerous Weapon(Pointing), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 941.20(1)(c) , a class A MISDEMANOR.  Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading and defendant pleads not guilty.  Case remains calendared for jury trial MARCH 31, 2014, 8:30am.  kmw

Defendant Dominic Champagne Glass in court with attorney Joseph E Schubert.  Defendant Dominic Champagne Glass in custody.  James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  MPD Officer Procopio Orlando.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Case is adjourned to Branch 34.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dominic Champagne Glass in court with attorney Benjamin J Peirce.  Defendant Dominic Champagne Glass in custody.  James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AMANDA Y. AND CHEE V.

  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.

Defendant Dominic Champagne Glass in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Defendant Dominic Champagne Glass in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
